TopicTitle: K.S.S. Kraken - three masted sailing ship

Articles.Content:
Ahoy ye land-lubbers!

This be my ship, the K.S.S. Kraken, and I be her captain!

With a top speed of 4m/s, she be slow, aye! But she sure be a beauty!

Me crew sleep here in these bunk rooms (there be two)

and I sleep here, in me state room!

I plot me course around the shoals and reefs here in me map room

Here be the cargo hold (no, that be not jet fuel and batteries!)

I start my day by stretchin' me legs amid-decks

then I head to the bow to stare at the briny deep!

At nights, I sing hearty sea shanties with me crew!

Ye can purchase me ship from the dockyards at: https://www.dropbox.com/s/320j7k8mdpspk4h/K_S_S_%20Kraken.craft?dl=0

Fair winds to ye!

GATOR

Nice! What's the part count? +1 rep

Edit: Dang need to spread more rep to give more out
Wow that's some serious detail. Have you had any unfortunate encounters with real krackens?
hmmm i might need this some day. great work though gGATOR!!!
Nice job gGATOR loven the detail and the map room
It's soooo awesome!!!

Haha awesome, just downloaded it, about to launch it now.

Edit:

It is launched, now time to sink it

Bombing attempts were unsuccessful. Drastic measures are called for, i must sacrifice a Goliath for the good of the space centre.

If a goliath does not kill it idk what will.

Edited September 2, 2014 by Roflcopterkklol
Very nice, I like the attention to detail.

Awesome.

You might enjoy some of these pics from a trip I took a few years ago: http://sailsofglory.org/album.php?albumid=247

Edited September 2, 2014 by Wanderfound
Um, this is a little nit-picky but on real three masted ships the mizzen mast was taller than the foremast but shorter than the mainmast.

Success! The pirates have been vanquished.

Admitted i think Goliath came out second best in the fight, damn good job building that ship man.

Success! The pirates have been vanquished.

Admitted i think Goliath came out second best in the fight, damn good job building that ship man.

Still afloat!

Tough little ship, that.

Still afloat!

Tough little ship, that.

You are telling me?

Goliath aint a small ship lol, it is 396 tonnes and there was still something left of the Kraken after i hit it at 130m/s.

Just damn.

Going to fly a Titan into it, i mean Titan is 535 tonnes.

Titan did a bit better than Goliath btw.

Thanks everybody! I'm glad y'all like it, I sure had fun building it!

Nice! What's the part count? +1 rep

Edit: Dang need to spread more rep to give more out

With the wheels attached (used to get it to the water), it's near 1000. I think. It's enough to make my puny MacBook Pro nearly have a seizure. I'll give you an exact number when I get home this evening.

Wow that's some serious detail. Have you had any unfortunate encounters with real krackens?

Besides that monstrosity that Roflcopterkklol slammed into my ship at 130m/s? Nope. No krackens, no sea monsters, no mermaids, nothing. Not even a fish. In fact, Kerbin's seas seem to be pretty lifeless!

Awesome.

You might enjoy some of these pics from a trip I took a few years ago: http://sailsofglory.org/album.php?albumid=247

http://sailsofglory.org/attachment.php?attachmentid=9612&d=1397288582

Beautiful!

Um, this is a little nit-picky but on real three masted ships the mizzen mast was taller than the foremast but shorter than the mainmast.

Of course, but, you see, with KSP's current wind physics, I found that having them the same height allowed my sails to catch more of the south-easterly breeze, enhancing my vessel's ability to tack into a strong gale

Success! The pirates have been vanquished.

Admitted i think Goliath came out second best in the fight, damn good job building that ship man.

AAARRGH! What are ye doing to me ship?!?! But for real, that is awesome! I appreciate you taking time out of your day to test the durability of my boat (I'm actually quite impressed with it's resilience!). What a good way to annihilate two gorgeous creations!

Nice! What's the part count? +1 rep
